SEARCH
Module ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2
Package ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes

Class Shape

java.lang.Object
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment2.paint.shapes.Shape
Direct Known Subclasses:
Oval, Polygon, Rectangle, Squiggle
public abstract class Shape extends Object
Abstract base class representing a shape instance on the canvas. A shape is defined by a start point, an end point, and a set of paint properties. It can be painted on the canvas and may be moved or checked for cursor inclusion.

Concrete subclasses of this class should implement the details of painting, filling, and cursor inclusion based on their specific shape.

Each shape has a start point, an end point, and an associated PaintProperties object. The shape can be painted (with or without filling), moved around on the canvas, and checked if a point lies within its bounds. Shapes can be finalized to indicate they are ready for use.

  • Constructor Details

    • Shape

      public Shape(Point start, Point end, String type, PaintProperties properties)
      Constructs a new Shape with the specified start and end points, type, and paint properties.
      Parameters:
      start - The starting point of the shape.
      end - The ending point of the shape.
      type - The type of the shape (e.g., "Rectangle", "Circle").
      properties - The paint properties, such as stroke color and thickness, and fill color.

  • Method Details

    • paint

      public abstract void paint(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext g2d)
      Paints the border of the shape on the canvas. The exact implementation is defined in subclasses. This method is called by the paint function to render the shape's outline.
      Parameters:
      g2d - The GraphicsContext used to paint the shape.

    • fill

      protected abstract void fill(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext g2d)
      Fills the shape with the appropriate color if the shape is marked as filled. The exact implementation is defined in subclasses. This method is used when the shape needs to be filled in addition to being outlined.
      Parameters:
      g2d - The GraphicsContext used to fill the shape.

    • getPaintInfo

      protected abstract double[] getPaintInfo()
      Returns basic paint information for the shape, such as its coordinates and dimensions. This information is used by the GraphicsContext to render the shape correctly on the canvas.
      Returns:
      An array of doubles representing the position and size (e.g., start X, start Y, width, height).

    • includeCursor

      public abstract boolean includeCursor(Point p)
      Checks whether the given point is inside the shape. This method is typically used to detect if a mouse cursor is within the bounds of the shape.
      Parameters:
      p - The point to check, typically derived from a mouse event's coordinates.
      Returns:
      true if the point is inside the shape, false otherwise.

    • move

      public abstract void move(double dx, double dy)
      Moves the shape by a specified displacement vector. This method updates the start and end points of the shape based on the displacement values.
      Parameters:
      dx - The displacement along the x-axis.
      dy - The displacement along the y-axis.

      Gets the list of points that define the shape.

      A list of points representing the shape.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the shape, including its start and end points, type, and properties. This is useful for debugging and logging purposes.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the shape.

    • finalizeShape

      public void finalizeShape()
      Marks the shape as finalized. This method can be overridden in subclasses if additional finalization logic is required (e.g., completing the creation of the shape).

    • isFinalized

      public boolean isFinalized()
      Checks whether the shape has been finalized. A finalized shape is ready for use.
      Returns:
      true if the shape is finalized, false otherwise.

    • setFinalized

      public void setFinalized(boolean finalized)
      Sets whether the shape is finalized.
      Parameters:
      finalized - true if the shape should be marked as finalized, false otherwise.
